text: Does anyone happen to know what the Betfair competition Ids are for the Dutch Eerste Divisie and the Scottish Premiership?  They're not being returned from listCompetitions at the moment as there aren't any markets yet.

elements.text: Does anyone happen to know what the Betfair competition Ids are for the Dutch Eerste Divisie and the Scottish Premiership?  They're not being returned from listCompetitions at the moment as there aren't any markets yet.

text: In my experience they always seem to be the same season to season

text:
Can the latest version of Flumine distinguish between types of simulation mode (by which I mean backtesting via historic data vs paper trading)?

The problem I'm trying to solve, is when in simulation (backtesting) use historic score data, but of course when in simulation (paper) use live score data.

I can check whether its in simulation mode, but is it possible to distinguish between the two, or do I need to create something myself?

elements.text:
Can the latest version of Flumine distinguish between types of simulation mode (by which I mean backtesting via historic data vs paper trading)?

The problem I'm trying to solve, is when in simulation (backtesting) use historic score data, but of course when in simulation (paper) use live score data.

I can check whether its in simulation mode, but is it possible to distinguish between the two, or do I need to create something myself?

text: this gets tricky, we need the simulation engine for paper trading but its on a per client basis, there is a flag in the `clients` class which might help?

elements.text: this gets tricky, we need the simulation engine for paper trading but its on a per client basis, there is a flag in the

text: Is anyone here using or has used the Proform racing software? Just looking to see whether people have found it useful for fundamental modelling purposes

elements.text: Is anyone here using or has used the Proform racing software? Just looking to see whether people have found it useful for fundamental modelling purposes

The proform data is in SQL server (last time I subscribed some years ago) so if you are on Windows then no need to export - just run queries to suit. Install SSMS (free) and explore with that. Use pyodbc for real time queries if you are a Python user. You can also run SQL queries from Excel.

attachments.fallback: [June 10th, 2022 1:09 PM] eanb: The proform data is in SQL server (last time I subscribed some years ago) so if you are on Windows then no need to export - just run queries to suit. Install SSMS (free) and explore with that. Use pyodbc for real time queries if you are a Python user. You can also run SQL queries from Excel.

text: Are the fans on peoples' desktops going crazy tonight? According to my desktop thermometer my ambient is only 25.6C, but my PC is a lot louder than usual. I've been putting off cleaning it. But it's never done this before.
